   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(z_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %%
   24: %% This suite expects to be run as the last suite of all suites.
   25: %%
   26: 
   27: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   28: 	    
   29: -record(core_search_conf, {db_top_dir,
   30:                            search_dir,
   31: 			   extra_search_dir,
   32: 			   cerl,
   33: 			   file,
   34: 			   run_by_ts}).
   35: 
   36: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   37: 
   38: -export([search_for_core_files/1, core_files/1]).
   39: 
   40: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   41:     
   42: suite() ->
   43:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   44:      {timetrap, {minutes, 10}}].
   45: 
   46: all() -> 
   47:     [core_files].
   48: 
   49: core_files(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   50:     case os:type() of
   51: 	{win32, _} ->
   52:             win32_search(true, os:getenv("OTP_DAILY_BUILD_TOP_DIR"));
   53: 	{unix, darwin} ->
   54: 	    core_file_search(
   55: 	      core_search_conf(true,
   56: 			       os:getenv("OTP_DAILY_BUILD_TOP_DIR"),
   57: 			       "/cores"));
   58: 	_ ->
   59: 	    core_file_search(
   60: 	      core_search_conf(true,
   61: 			       os:getenv("OTP_DAILY_BUILD_TOP_DIR")))
   62:     end.
   63: 
   64: search_for_core_files(Dir) ->
   65:     case os:type() of
   66: 	{win32, _} ->
   67:             win32_search(false, Dir);
   68: 	{unix, darwin} ->
   69: 	    core_file_search(core_search_conf(false, Dir, "/cores"));
   70: 	_ ->
   71: 	    core_file_search(core_search_conf(false, Dir))
   72:     end.
   73:     
   74: find_cerl(false) ->
   75:     case os:getenv("ERL_TOP") of
   76: 	false -> false;
   77: 	ETop ->
   78: 	    Cerl = filename:join([ETop, "bin", "cerl"]),
   79: 	    case filelib:is_regular(Cerl) of
   80: 		true -> Cerl;
   81: 		_ -> false
   82: 	    end
   83:     end;
   84: find_cerl(DBTop) ->
   85:     case catch filelib:wildcard(filename:join([DBTop,
   86: 					       "otp_src_*",
   87: 					       "bin",
   88: 					       "cerl"])) of
   89: 	[Cerl | _ ] ->
   90: 	    case filelib:is_regular(Cerl) of
   91: 		true -> Cerl;
   92: 		_ -> find_cerl(false)
   93: 	    end;
   94: 	_ ->
   95: 	    find_cerl(false)
   96:     end.
   97: 
   98: is_dir(false) ->
   99:     false;
  100: is_dir(Dir) ->
  101:     filelib:is_dir(Dir).
  102: 
  103: core_search_conf(RunByTS, DBTop) ->
  104:     core_search_conf(RunByTS, DBTop, false).
  105: 
  106: core_search_conf(RunByTS, DBTop, XDir) ->
  107:     SearchDir = search_dir(DBTop),
  108:     XSearchDir = case is_dir(XDir) of
  109: 		     false ->
  110: 			 false;
  111: 		     true ->
  112: 			 case SearchDir == XDir of
  113: 			     true -> false;
  114: 			     _ -> XDir
  115: 			 end
  116: 		 end,
  117:     #core_search_conf{db_top_dir = DBTop,
  118:                       search_dir = SearchDir,
  119: 		      extra_search_dir = XSearchDir,
  120: 		      cerl = find_cerl(DBTop),
  121: 		      file = os:find_executable("file"),
  122: 		      run_by_ts = RunByTS}.
  123: 
  124: search_dir(DBTop) ->
  125:     case is_dir(DBTop) of
  126:         false ->
  127:             case code:which(test_server) of
  128:                 non_existing ->
  129:                     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
  130:                     CWD;
  131:                 TS ->
  132:                     filename:dirname(filename:dirname(TS))
  133:             end;
  134:         true ->
  135:             DBTop
  136:     end.
  137: 
  138: file_inspect(#core_search_conf{file = File}, Core) ->
  139:     FRes0 = os:cmd(File ++ " " ++ Core),
  140:     FRes = case string:split(FRes0, Core) of
  141: 	       [S1] -> S1;
  142: 	       [S1,S2] -> lists:flatten(S1 ++ " " ++ S2)
  143: 	   end,
  144:     case re:run(FRes, "text|ascii", [caseless,{capture,none}]) of
  145: 	match ->
  146: 	    not_a_core;
  147: 	nomatch ->
  148: 	    probably_a_core
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: mk_readable(F) ->    
  152:     try
  153: 	{ok, Old} = file:read_file_info(F),
  154: 	file:write_file_info(F, Old#file_info{mode = 8#00444})
  155:     catch	
  156: 	_:_ -> io:format("Failed to \"chmod\" core file ~p\n", [F])
  157:     end.
  158: 
  159: ignore_core(C) ->
  160:     filelib:is_regular(filename:join([filename:dirname(C),
  161: 				      "ignore_core_files"])).
  162: 
  163: core_cand(#core_search_conf{file = false}, C, Cs) ->
  164:     %% Guess that it is a core file; make it readable by anyone and save it
  165:     mk_readable(C),
  166:     [C|Cs];
  167: core_cand(Conf, C, Cs) ->
  168:     case file_inspect(Conf, C) of
  169: 	not_a_core -> Cs;
  170: 	_ ->
  171: 	    %% Probably a core file; make it readable by anyone and save it
  172: 	    mk_readable(C),
  173: 	    case ignore_core(C) of
  174: 		true -> [{ignore, C}|Cs];
  175: 		_ -> [C|Cs]
  176: 	    end
  177:     end.
  178: 
  179: time_fstr() ->
  180:     "(~w-~.2.0w-~.2.0w ~w.~.2.0w:~.2.0w)".
  181: mod_time_list(F) ->
  182:     case catch filelib:last_modified(F) of
  183: 	{{Y,Mo,D},{H,Mi,S}} ->
  184: 	    [Y,Mo,D,H,Mi,S];
  185: 	_ ->
  186: 	    [0,0,0,0,0,0]
  187:     end.
  188: 
  189: dump_core(#core_search_conf{ cerl = false }, _) ->
  190:     ok;
  191: dump_core(_, {ignore, _Core}) ->
  192:     ok;
  193: dump_core(#core_search_conf{ cerl = Cerl }, Core) ->
  194:     Dump = case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  195:                opt ->
  196:                    os:cmd(Cerl ++ " -dump " ++ Core);
  197:                Type ->
  198: 		   os:cmd(lists:concat([Cerl," -",Type," -dump ",Core]))
  199:            end,
  200:     ct:log("~ts~n~n~ts",[Core,Dump]).
  201: 
  202: format_core(Conf, {ignore, Core}) ->
  203:     format_core(Conf, Core, "[ignored] ");
  204: format_core(Conf, Core) ->
  205:     format_core(Conf, Core, ""),
  206: 
  207:     %% Try print (log dir) name of offending application
  208:     CoreDir = filename:dirname(Core),
  209:     lists:foreach(fun(TestDir) ->
  210:                           FullTestDir = filename:join(CoreDir,TestDir),
  211: 			  case filelib:is_dir(FullTestDir) of
  212: 			      true ->
  213: 				  io:format("  from ~s\n", [TestDir]),
  214:                                   print_last_testcase(FullTestDir);
  215: 			      false ->
  216: 				  no
  217: 			  end
  218: 		  end,
  219: 		  filelib:wildcard("*.logs", CoreDir)).
  220: 
  221: print_last_testcase(FullTestDir) ->
  222:     lists:foreach(fun(RunDir) ->
  223:                           SuiteLog = filename:join([FullTestDir,RunDir,"suite.log"]),
  224:                           try last_testcase(SuiteLog) of
  225:                               TestCase ->
  226:                                   io:format("       ~s\n", [TestCase])
  227:                           catch
  228:                               error:Reason ->
  229:                                   io:format("  could not find last test case: ~p\n", [Reason])
  230:                           end
  231: 		  end,
  232: 		  filelib:wildcard("run.*", FullTestDir)).
  233: 
  234: last_testcase(SuiteLog) ->
  235:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(SuiteLog),
  236:     case string:find(Bin, "\n=case", trailing) of
  237:         TailBin when is_binary(TailBin) ->
  238:             {match, [TestCase]} = re:run(TailBin, "=case\\s+(.+)",
  239:                                          [{capture,all_but_first,binary}]),
  240:             TestCase
  241:     end.
  242: 
  243: format_core(#core_search_conf{file = false}, Core, Ignore) ->
  244:     io:format("  ~s~s " ++ time_fstr() ++ "~s~n",
  245: 	      [Ignore, Core] ++ mod_time_list(Core));
  246: format_core(#core_search_conf{file = File}, Core, Ignore) ->
  247:     FRes = string:trim(os:cmd(File ++ " " ++ Core)),
  248:     case catch re:run(FRes, Core, [caseless,{capture,none}]) of
  249: 	match ->
  250: 	    io:format("  ~s~s " ++ time_fstr() ++ "~n",
  251: 		      [Ignore, FRes] ++ mod_time_list(Core));
  252: 	_ ->
  253: 	    io:format("  ~s~s: ~s " ++ time_fstr() ++ "~n",
  254: 		      [Ignore, Core, FRes] ++ mod_time_list(Core))
  255:     end.
  256: 
  257: core_file_search(#core_search_conf{search_dir = Base,
  258: 				   extra_search_dir = XBase,
  259: 				   cerl = Cerl,
  260: 				   run_by_ts = RunByTS} = Conf) ->
  261:     case {Cerl,erlang:system_info(build_type)} of
  262: 	{false,_} -> ok;
  263: 	{_,opt} ->
  264: 	    catch io:format("A cerl script that probably can be used for "
  265: 			    "inspection of emulator cores:~n  ~s~n",
  266: 			    [Cerl]);
  267: 	{_,Type} ->
  268: 	    catch io:format("A cerl script that probably can be used for "
  269: 			    "inspection of emulator cores:~n  ~s -emu_type ~p~n",
  270: 			    [Cerl,Type])
  271:     end,
  272: 
  273:     case os:getenv("DOCKER_BUILD_INFO") of
  274:         false -> ok;
  275:         Info ->
  276:             io:format(Info)
  277:     end,
  278: 
  279:     io:format("Searching for core-files in: ~s~s~n",
  280: 	      [case XBase of
  281: 		   false -> "";
  282: 		   _ -> XBase ++ " and "
  283: 	       end,
  284: 	       Base]),
  285:     Filter = fun (Core, Cores) ->
  286: 		     case filelib:is_regular(Core) of
  287: 			 true ->
  288: 			     case filename:basename(Core) of
  289: 				 "core" ->
  290: 				     core_cand(Conf, Core, Cores);
  291: 				 "core." ++ _ ->
  292: 				     core_cand(Conf, Core, Cores);
  293: 				 "vgcore." ++ _ -> % valgrind
  294: 				     core_cand(Conf, Core, Cores);
  295: 				 Bin when is_binary(Bin) -> %Icky filename; ignore
  296: 				     Cores;
  297: 				 BName ->
  298: 				     case lists:suffix(".core", BName) of
  299: 					 true -> core_cand(Conf, Core, Cores);
  300: 					 _ -> Cores
  301: 				     end
  302: 			     end;
  303: 			 _ ->
  304: 			     Cores
  305: 		     end
  306: 	     end,
  307:     case case XBase of
  308: 	     false -> [];
  309: 	     _ -> filelib:fold_files(XBase, "core", true, Filter, [])
  310: 	 end ++ filelib:fold_files(Base, "core", true, Filter, []) of
  311: 	[] ->
  312: 	    io:format("No core-files found.~n", []),
  313: 	    ok;
  314: 	Cores ->
  315: 	    io:format("Found core files:~n",[]),
  316: 	    lists:foreach(fun (C) -> format_core(Conf, C) end, Cores),
  317: 	    {ICores, FCores} = lists:foldl(fun ({ignore, IC}, {ICs, FCs}) ->
  318: 						   {[" "++IC|ICs], FCs};
  319: 					       (FC, {ICs, FCs}) ->
  320: 						   {ICs, [" "++FC|FCs]}
  321: 					   end,
  322: 					   {[],[]},
  323: 					   Cores),
  324: 	    ICoresComment =
  325: 		"Core-files marked with [ignored] were found in directories~n"
  326: 		"containing an ignore_core_files file, i.e., the testcase~n"
  327: 		"writer has decided that core-files dumped there should be~n"
  328: 		"ignored. This testcase won't fail on ignored core-files~n"
  329: 		"found.~n",
  330: 	    Res = lists:flatten([case FCores of
  331: 				     [] ->
  332: 					 [];
  333: 				     _ ->
  334: 					 ["Core-files found:",
  335: 					  lists:reverse(FCores)]
  336: 				 end,
  337: 				 case {FCores, ICores} of
  338: 				     {[], []} -> [];
  339: 				     {_, []} -> [];
  340: 				     {[], _} -> [];
  341: 				     _ -> " "
  342: 				 end,
  343: 				 case ICores of
  344: 				     [] -> [];
  345: 				     _ ->
  346: 					 io:format(ICoresComment, []),
  347: 					 ["Ignored core-files found:",
  348: 					  lists:reverse(ICores)]
  349: 				 end]),
  350: 
  351: 	    lists:foreach(fun(C) -> dump_core(Conf,C) end, Cores),
  352: 	    case {RunByTS, ICores, FCores} of
  353: 		{true, [], []} -> ok;
  354: 		{true, _, []} -> {comment, Res};
  355: 		{true, _, _} ->
  356:                     docker_export_otp_src(Conf),
  357:                     ct:fail(Res);
  358: 		_ ->
  359:                     Res
  360: 	    end
  361:     end.
  362: 
  363: docker_export_otp_src(#core_search_conf{db_top_dir = DbTop}) ->
  364:     %% If this is a docker run, export the otp_src directory
  365:     %% to not get lost when the docker image is purged.
  366:     try
  367:         case {is_dir(DbTop), is_dir("/daily_build/otp_src/erts")}  of
  368:             {true, true} ->
  369:                 %% Stolen from get_otp_src script.
  370:                 %% Basically it's a recursive copy of otp_src dir
  371:                 %% with preserved permissions, etc.
  372:                 run("cd /daily_build && "
  373:                     "tar -cf - otp_src | (cd "++DbTop++" && tar -xpf -)"),
  374:                 OtpSrc = DbTop ++ "/otp_src",
  375:                 run("cd " ++ OtpSrc ++ "/erts && "
  376:                     "ERL_TOP=" ++ OtpSrc ++ " make local_setup"),
  377:                 io:format("otp_src directory exported from docker image");
  378:             _ ->
  379:                 ok
  380:         end
  381:     catch
  382:         C:E:S ->
  383:             io:format("Failed to export otp_src directory:"
  384:                       "Exception: ~p\nReason: ~p\nStack: ~p\n",
  385:                       [C, E, S])
  386:     end.
  387: 
  388: run(Cmd) ->
  389:     Options = [binary, exit_status,stderr_to_stdout,{line,4096}],
  390:     Port = open_port({spawn,"sh -c \"" ++ Cmd ++ "\""}, Options),
  391:     run_loop(Cmd, Port, []).
  392: 
  393: run_loop(Cmd, Port, Output) ->
  394:     receive
  395:         {Port, {exit_status,0}} ->
  396:             lists:reverse(Output);
  397:         {Port, {exit_status,Status}} ->
  398:             io:format("Failed command (~p): ~p\nOutput: ~p\n", [Status, Cmd, Output]),
  399:             error(bailout);
  400:         {Port, {data,{eol,Bin}}} ->
  401:             run_loop(Cmd, Port, [Bin|Output]);
  402:         Msg ->
  403:             io:format("Unexpected message: ~p\nCommand was: ~p\n", [Msg, Cmd]),
  404:             error(bailout)
  405:     end.
  406: 
  407: 
  408: win32_search(RunByTS, DBTop) ->
  409:     case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
  410:         false when RunByTS ->
  411:             {skipped, "No idea searching for core-files on old windows"};
  412:         false ->
  413:             io:format("No idea searching for core-files on old windows");
  414:         _ ->
  415:             win32_search_2(RunByTS, DBTop)
  416:     end.
  417: 
  418: win32_search_2(true, DBTop0) ->
  419:     DBTop = search_dir(DBTop0),
  420:     Dir = "c:/ldisk/daily_build",
  421:     io:format("Find and move 'dmp' files in: ~s to ~s~n",[Dir, DBTop]),
  422:     case filelib:wildcard("*.dmp", Dir) of
  423:         [] -> ok;
  424:         Dumps ->
  425:             %% We move the "daily" dmp files to this test-run
  426:             Str = lists:flatten(["Core-files found:", lists:join($\s, lists:reverse(Dumps))]),
  427:             Rename = fun(File) ->
  428:                              FP = filename:join(Dir, File),
  429:                              _ = file:rename(FP, filename:join(DBTop, File))
  430:                      end,
  431:             [Rename(File) || File <- Dumps],
  432:             ct:fail(Str)
  433:     end;
  434: win32_search_2(false, _DBTop0) ->
  435:     DBTop = search_dir("c:/ldisk/daily_build"),
  436:     io:format("Search for 'dmp' files in: ~s~n",[DBTop]),
  437:     case filelib:wildcard("*.dmp", DBTop) of
  438:         [] -> "Core-files found: Ignored core-files found:";
  439:         Dumps ->
  440:             io:format("The dmp files must be removed manually\n", []),
  441:             lists:flatten(["Core-files found:", lists:join($\s, lists:reverse(Dumps))])
  442:     end.
